Ruby beer with tight medium head. Aroma is caramel and dark fruit. Taste is rich malt, caramel, dark fruits and some toffee. Sticky palate. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Cask, The Salmon, Leicester. Very dark brown with a beige foam. Aromas are dark chocolate and liquorice with pepper. Hints of soy sauce with dark berry fruit. Xmas pudding with earthy roast notes and hints of marzipan. Flavours are plummy sweet xmas pudding with dark cherries and berries. Earthy with some citrus tang. Medicinal with a solid roast backbone. Very nice.

Cask at the Jolly Crispin during the RateBeer Black Country Bus Bash. Pours clear amber with a creamy, light tan head. Toasty bread aroma with hints of sugary fruits, ripe berries. Medium sweet flavor with brown bread, more ripe berries, some dark fruits. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with bready semi-dark malts and lots of ripe, sugary fruits. Nice stuff.

Cask @ The Jolly Crispin during the Ratebeer Black Country Bash. Yes! A beer that isnt a golden ale!!!! The pours deep red with a tiny off-white head. The nose is red berry, marzipan. A bit of nut, cake mix. The taste is rich toffee, caramel. Acidic red apple, berry compote. Coke. Medium body, smooth, slightly creamy. Overall, pleasing work. A nice change of pace on this occasion.
Black country bus bash Cask at the Jolly Crispin. Sweet berry aroma. Some chalk. Ruby red checsnut with a persistent beige head. Sweet date and raisin flavour. Nice drop.

Half-pint of cask at the Jolly Crispin while on the RB Black Country Bash 6th July 2013. Good looking brew, Ruby coloured with a full and rich light tan foaming head. Nose was chocolate malts and dark fruits. 

The taste was also chocolate and dark fruits with other malty notes like caramel and toffee. It wasnt however as sweet as those flavours might indicate: there was a bitter hop undertone throughout the half-pint.

My favourite new cask ale of the day: my sweet tooth really enjoyed this and I thought it different and almost on par with another Ruby Mild brewed just up the road!

Cask at the Jolly Crispin, Gornal, on the RB Black Country Bash - 06/07/13.
Mahogony brown with a thin light tan head that dissipates edgeward.
Nose is bready malts, dark fruits, raisens, sugars.
Taste comprises dark fruit, toffee, brown sugar, dates.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, fruity tang and sweetish in the finish.
Decent fruity strong mild.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 6th July 2013Black Country Beano. Cask at the Jolly Crispin. Light haze on this amber beer, tidy pale cream coloured head. Soft and light palate, low carbonation. Sweetish creamy malt, trace of caramel. Mild tangy fruits. Nice mouthfeel on this one.
Cask handpull at Jolly Crispin. Mid brown clear colour. Downed in one to give me a chance to get to Britainnia for a half. Decent beer drinkable full in mouth and decent pepper hop on the finish.
Cask at the Jolly Crispin, Gornal. Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma is chocolate with a little bit of coffee. Taste has dark chocolate to start with a chocolate coffee finish.

Cask conditioned at The Jolly Crispin, Upper Gornal, W.Midlands. Chestnut with off white head. There is a solid, malty body, good roasty notes with a hint of smokiness for me. There is a fruity, berry like flavour within the body. A pretty accomplished mild.

Cask conditioned	handpump	Salmon	Leicester	18/06/13. A dark brown to ruby coloured beer with a tight whitish head and lace. A nice strong fruity malty beer. Good berries in the nose. Chocolate dipped cherries in the mouth. A good finish. A tasty and almost warming beer.
